gaia::core::Gravity Class Reference

Standard constants and tools for placing an object within a potentially larger container. More...

#include <Gravity.h>

List of all members.

Public Types

enum  { NO_GRAVITY = 0x0000 }
 Constant indicating that no gravity has been set. More...
enum  { AXIS_SPECIFIED = 0x0001 }
 Raw bit indicating the gravity for an axis has been specified. More...
enum  { AXIS_PULL_BEFORE = 0x0002 }
 Raw bit controlling how the left/top edge is placed. More...
enum  { AXIS_PULL_AFTER = 0x0004 }
 Raw bit controlling how the right/bottom edge is placed. More...
enum  { AXIS_CLIP = 0x0008 }
 Raw bit controlling whether the right/bottom edge is clipped to its container, based on the gravity direction being applied. More...
enum  { AXIS_X_SHIFT = 0 }
 Bits defining the horizontal axis. More...
enum  { AXIS_Y_SHIFT = 4 }
 Bits defining the vertical axis. More...
enum  { TOP = (AXIS_PULL_BEFORE|AXIS_SPECIFIED) << AXIS_Y_SHIFT }
 Push object to the top of its container, not changing its size. More...
enum  { BOTTOM = (AXIS_PULL_AFTER|AXIS_SPECIFIED) << AXIS_Y_SHIFT }
 Push object to the bottom of its container, not changing its size. More...
enum  { LEFT = (AXIS_PULL_BEFORE|AXIS_SPECIFIED) << AXIS_X_SHIFT }
 Push object to the left of its container, not changing its size. More...
enum  { RIGHT = (AXIS_PULL_AFTER|AXIS_SPECIFIED) << AXIS_X_SHIFT }
 Push object to the right of its container, not changing its size. More...
enum  { CENTER_VERTICAL = AXIS_SPECIFIED << AXIS_Y_SHIFT }
 Place object in the vertical center of its container, not changing its size. More...
enum  { FILL_VERTICAL = TOP|BOTTOM }
 Grow the vertical size of the object if needed so it completely fills its container. More...
enum  { CENTER_HORIZONTAL = AXIS_SPECIFIED << AXIS_X_SHIFT }
 Place object in the horizontal center of its container, not changing its size. More...
enum  { FILL_HORIZONTAL = LEFT|RIGHT }
 Grow the horizontal size of the object if needed so it completely fills its container. More...
enum  { CENTER = CENTER_VERTICAL|CENTER_HORIZONTAL }
 Place the object in the center of its container in both the vertical and horizontal axis, not changing its size. More...
enum  { FILL = FILL_VERTICAL|FILL_HORIZONTAL }
 Grow the horizontal and vertical size of the object if needed so it completely fills its container. More...
enum  { CLIP_VERTICAL = AXIS_CLIP << AXIS_Y_SHIFT }
 Flag to clip the edges of the object to its container along the vertical axis. More...
enum  { CLIP_HORIZONTAL = AXIS_CLIP << AXIS_X_SHIFT }
 Flag to clip the edges of the object to its container along the horizontal axis. More...
enum  { HORIZONTAL_GRAVITY_MASK }
 Binary mask to get the horizontal gravity of a gravity. More...
enum  { VERTICAL_GRAVITY_MASK }
 Binary mask to get the vertical gravity of a gravity. More...
enum  { DISPLAY_CLIP_VERTICAL = 0x10000000 }
 Special constant to enable clipping to an overall display along the vertical dimension. More...
enum  { DISPLAY_CLIP_HORIZONTAL = 0x01000000 }
 Special constant to enable clipping to an overall display along the horizontal dimension. More...

Detailed Description

Standard constants and tools for placing an object within a potentially larger container.

Member Function Documentation

void gaia::core::Gravity::apply ( int32_t  gravity,
int32_t  w,
int32_t  h,
const graphics::Rect *  container,
const graphics::Rect *  outRect 
)

Apply a gravity constant to an object.

Parameters:
gravityThe desired placement of the object, as defined by the constants in this class.
wThe horizontal size of the object.
hThe vertical size of the object.
containerThe frame of the containing space, in which the object will be placed.
outRectReceives the computed frame of the object in its container.
void gaia::core::Gravity::apply ( int32_t  gravity,
int32_t  w,
int32_t  h,
const graphics::Rect *  container,
int32_t  xAdj,
int32_t  yAdj,
const graphics::Rect *  outRect 
)

Apply a gravity constant to an object.

Parameters:
gravityThe desired placement of the object, as defined by the constants in this class.
wThe horizontal size of the object.
hThe vertical size of the object.
containerThe frame of the containing space, in which the object will be placed.
xAdjOffset to apply to the X axis. If gravity is LEFT this pushes it to the right; if gravity is RIGHT it pushes it to the left; if gravity is CENTER_HORIZONTAL it pushes it to the right or left; otherwise it is ignored.
yAdjOffset to apply to the Y axis. If gravity is TOP this pushes it down; if gravity is BOTTOM it pushes it up; if gravity is CENTER_VERTICAL it pushes it down or up; otherwise it is ignored.
outRectReceives the computed frame of the object in its container.
void gaia::core::Gravity::applyDisplay ( int32_t  gravity,
const graphics::Rect *  display,
const graphics::Rect *  inoutObj 
)

Apply additional gravity behavior based on the overall "display" that an object exists in.

By default this moves or clips the object to be visible in the display.

Parameters:
gravityGravity constants to modify the placement within the display.
displayThe rectangle of the display in which the object is being placed.
inoutObjSupplies the current object position; returns with it modified if needed to fit in the display.
bool gaia::core::Gravity::isHorizontal ( int32_t  gravity)

Indicate whether the supplied gravity has an horizontal pull.

Parameters:
gravityThe gravity to check for horizontal pull.
Returns:
True if the supplied gravity has a horizontal pull.
bool gaia::core::Gravity::isVertical ( int32_t  gravity)

Indicate whether the supplied gravity has a vertical pull.

Parameters:
gravityThe gravity to check for vertical pull.
Returns:
True if the supplied gravity has a vertical pull.
